nodes.priorLine:
The line rings once, like it already knows youre there.
Then a voicemail answers, bright and pre-defensive.
nodes.lineToEdit:
Hi! Youve reached Field Interface Support for SECV legacy devices.
If youre calling about abnormal output, anomalous imaging, unexpected reflective behavior, or anything that could be described as nonstandard, that is not covered.

We support: jams, rollers, trays, and manufacturer-listed error codes.
We do not support: facilities, incidents, atmospheres, or situations.

If this is about a service codeservice codes are not a service issue.
They are an authorization issue.
Thank you for understanding, which is required.
nodes.nextLine: The voicemail hangs up first, like a practiced skill.
nodes.revisedLine:
Hi. (pause) You've reached Field Interface Support. (pause) For SECV legacy devices. (pause)
If you're calling about abnormal output. (pause) Or anomalous imaging. (pause) Or unexpected reflective behavior. (pause) Or anything you'd call 'nonstandard'. (pause) We can't cover it. (pause)
We handle jams. (pause) Rollers. (pause) Trays. (pause) Manufacturer listed error codes. (pause)
Facilities. (pause) Incidents. (pause) Atmospheres. (pause) 'Situations'. (pause) Don't put those on this line. (pause)
If this is about a service code. (pause) Yeah stop there. (pause) That goes through authorization. (pause)
Thanks for understanding. (pause) It's required.
nodes.changeSummary: Made the voicemail sound more in-the-moment and defensive; tightened phrasing, kept all exclusions/support categories and the service-code-as-authorization requirement. | Split the line into short beats using (pause) so each beat stays under 8 words. Replaced comma-heavy lists with sentence fragments and line breaks to keep commas under the limit, without changing meaning or tone.

nodes.revisedLine: Hi. (pause) Field Interface Support for SECV legacy devices. (pause) If this is abnormal output (pause) or anomalous imaging (pause) or unexpected reflective behavior (pause) anything you’d call “nonstandard” (pause) we can’t cover it.
nodes.changeSummary: Trimmed and roughened the greeting; kept the same triggers and the same exclusion (nonstandard not covered) without adding explanation. | Split the line into short beats using (pause) to keep each beat under 8 words. Removed list commas while keeping the same exclusions and tone.

nodes.priorLine:
Hi! Youve reached Field Interface Support for SECV legacy devices.
If youre calling about abnormal output, anomalous imaging, unexpected reflective behavior, or anything that could be described as nonstandard, that is not covered.
nodes.lineToEdit:
We support: jams, rollers, trays, and manufacturer-listed error codes.
We do not support: facilities, incidents, atmospheres, or situations.

If this is about a service codeservice codes are not a service issue.
They are an authorization issue.
Thank you for understanding, which is required.
nodes.nextLine:
The voicemail ends like a door latch.
The exclusions are weirdly reusable.
nodes.revisedLine:
We handle jams. (pause) Rollers. (pause) Trays. (pause) Manufacturer-listed error codes. (pause)
Facilities / incidents / atmospheres / situations? (pause) Don’t put those on this line. (pause)
If this is a service code, (pause) Authorization has to clear it. (pause)
Thanks for understanding. (pause) It’s required.
nodes.changeSummary: Converted listy compliance phrasing into clipped support-line shorthand; preserved supported items, excluded items, and the service-code/authorization requirement. | Split into short (pause) beats under 8 words. Removed extra commas by switching the second list to slashes; kept one comma in the service-code line.
